choices.B: The two VLAN sub interfaces must have different VLAN IDs.
choices.D: The two VLAN sub interfaces can have the same VLAN ID, only if they have IP addresses in the same subnet.
choices.C: The two VLAN sub interfaces can have the same VLAN ID, only if they belong to different VDOMs.
choices.A: The two VLAN sub interfaces can have the same VLAN ID, only if they have IP addresses in different subnets.

discussion.content: B is correct, D is not correct - no information that FortiG is in multi-VDOM mode

comments.content: B is the answer in the solution or was it D before. I think B is correct too.

questions.question_text:
A FortiGate is operating in NAT mode and configured with two virtual LAN (VLAN) subinterfaces added to the physical interface.
In this scenario, which statement about the VLAN IDs is true?

choices.D: DNAT using central NAT requires a VIP object as the destination address in a firewall policy.
choices.C: IP pool references must be removed from existing firewall policies, before enabling central NAT.
choices.A: SNAT using central NAT does not require a central SNAT policy.
choices.B: Central NAT can be enabled or disabled from the CLI only.

questions.question_text: Which two statements about central NAT are true? (Choose two.)

discussion.content:
B and C are correct.

FortiGate_Security_6.4 P.164

B is correct -> security guide 6.4 p163
C is correct
D is incorrect : As soon as a VIP or DNAT rule is created, no need for IPV4 policy. It is implicitely allowed. We can block trafic by adding IPV4 policy

B is wrong
If NGFW mode is policy-based, then it is assumed that central-nat (specifically SNAT) is enabled implicitly.

From GUI: 
Got to System -> Settings, under 'Inspection Mode' select 'Flow-based and under 'NGFW Mode' select 'Profil-based'.


From CLI.

 # Config sys setting
 set central-nat disable
 end
https://kb.fortinet.com/kb/documentLink.do?externalID=FD49932
D is not correct - Security_manual-6.2, p. 167
B & C are correct - Security_manual-6.2, p.164
B is wrong, Central NAT can be enabled from CLI/GUI

comments.content: When central NAT is enabled in CLI, Policy & Objects displays the Central SNAT section in GUI so B is right.

choices.A: The private key of the CA certificate that is signed the browser certificate must be installed on the browser.
choices.B: The CA certificate that signed the web server certificate must be installed on the browser.
choices.C: The public key of the web server certificate must be installed on the web browser.
choices.D: The web-server certificate must be installed on the browser.

questions.question_text: Which condition must be met in order for a web browser to trust a web server certificate signed by a third-party CA?

choices.B: Addicting.Games will be allowed only if the Filter Overrides action is set to Learn.
choices.D: Addicting.Games will be allowed, based on the Application Overrides configuration.
choices.A: Addicting.Games will be blocked, based on the Filter Overrides configuration.
choices.C: Addicting.Games will be allowed, based on the Categories configuration.

questions.question_text:
Refer to the exhibit.

A user located behind the FortiGate device is trying to go to http://www.addictinggames.com (Addicting.Games). The exhibit shows the application detains and application control profile.
Based on this configuration, which statement is true?
